Verified Resident
2016 - 2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 11/24/2017
Lots of changes in the leasing office. I have had so many managers in the short time I have rented on this property. I asked people when they say they are leaving I asked why they say it is the nature of the business. Also, when you submit a maintenance request like need new filter--you never get a response back. To even say "hey your filter is on back order." Or we got received your request and we will bring and install your filter on xx date. Follow is less than desirable sometimes.

11

Verified Manager11/27/2017

I am sorry to see that you have not had a positive experience, that is not at all what we are trying to accomplish. You are correct, lots of changes with the staff but we feel we have a great staff in place and we are hoping to make sure that everyone has a great experience while living here at Springfield. We have had some bumps in the road but we are looking to make sure that tenants are notified of anything holding up a maintenance request. If a request is put in on-line, our goal is to have it completed within 48-hours, if you would like us to call you before we take care of the request, please note that in your work order. Thank you for your comments, it does help us to understand where we are lacking. If you still have a maintenance request that is not complete, please call the office and we will make sure it is taken care of ASAP.

Verified Resident
2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 11/21/2017
Within a week of moving our apartment flooded due to a pipe problem with the unit above us. The number on the website for emergencies was the office number, so no one was around at 7am to handle the emergency. 4 months later they finally fixed the hold in our ceiling (after being told it would be fixed in a week). Our washer/dryer would not hooked up properly, and the crew who put it in did not take the doors to the closet they go in off so the handles were busted off. The new management seems more concerned with outside aesthetics than their own residents.

Report
Verified Resident
2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/02/2017
The maintenance staff is not efficient and they half complete their work and do it in a rushed manner requiring you to submit multiple work requests. There are hidden mandatory valet fees and pest control fees. Your water bill is through the Property not the city. There is a fee to pay your rent online. When inspecting a unit make sure you look diligently as you will be able to notice the rushed work of the maintenance staff. The parking spaces are very close to one another but at some buildings there is plenty of parking but you may have to walk further to get to your unit. Keep that in mind when you are grocery shopping or invest in a cart to aid you. The inside of the cabinets --the height/spacing for each shelf-- is short so you might not be able to place tall items inside your cabinets. The office staff say they are trying to improve the property. The car wash section and the tennis court sections need to be improved. The Clubhouse was just improved, I am not certain about the swimming pool. The office staff are friendly. The walls are paper thin inside the apartments. People who are outside, you are able to hear their conversations from inside of your apartment.

Report
Verified Resident
2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/20/2017
The environment and wooded area is beautiful. The renovations are very modern. However, I have not felt very safe with some of my issues here. The painters that were hired here painted over the dryer vent outside the building. I had been running my dryer for several cycles that would never dry my clothes. I didn't know anything about the vent until I traced the problem outside and had to pry open the vents and pull out a plastic bag. HUGE FIRE HAZARD! Also my most recent issue is the electrical. My power had been surging throughout the apartment. Some days my outlets will work and sometimes they won't. I went without my washer and my stove for over a week because the breakers were arcing. Turns out that the arcing actually fried the breaker panel and melted the back. ANOTHER FIRE HAZARD. Now everything is fixed, but it's only a matter of time before something else goes wrong. I will say this. My little issues were fixed and the staff is dealing with an older complex so there are going to be issues. However, before these apartments are rented out to people, everything needs to be checked out thoroughly not half assed. These can be major and life threatening issues if not addressed.

Absolutely the worst place to live in Durham, NC. The apartment buildings are old and not well kept. Constant standing water on the property. The buildings leak due to rain. When I moved into my apartment, the unit was not ready. The garbage disposal and dish washer were both broken. The unit was not properly clean for a move- in. It was clear the property manager did not do a walk through prior to me moving in. The apartment staff is totally incompetent and rude. Honestly, if I could go back in time I would tell my past self to avoid giving them my business. If you're looking for a nice place to live, stay away Springfield!

Report
Resident
2014 - 2016 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/01/2016
I have lived her for two years. the staff that was here when i first moved in were awesome. They came and fixed things right away, they listened and were very helpful and knowledgable and generally left you a lone, and were reasonable. The people that runs this place now (summer 2016), i have no idea where they found them, but they are not very helpful. If you have something broken, get used to it not working because it takes them forever to fix it, if they fix it at all. Half the time you have to bug them about it three or four times before they come out or say they came out. I came to them about half my outlets not working, they said they checked them and they work, but they don't! i pay over 900 a month for this apartment and things don't work, and don't get fixed. They also started checking in your packages, so you have to sign off on that. I am fine with that, except for when they tell me that it was checked in and i get texts from them several times a week for the package i picked up a week or two before. They need to get with the program, and communicate with each other. I have found that the staff is generally not knowledge or helpful. They all say different things, and you are left not really knowing what is going on. I moved to another apartment in this complex last spring, they completely messed up my move in date. I double checked with the staff and they gave me the date the people in the apartment i moved into were leaving. I had to wait a whole entire week with my stuff all packed and piled into the living room to move in. Unacceptable. The manager nor the staff where apologetic, or compensated us in anyway. They also invade your privacy now. They treat these apartment like its a college dorm. They inspect it, and make you clean up. It would be nice if they gave us a couple days, but two days before an inspection they tell us to clean up. I can't speak for most of the residents in the complex but i work really long hectic hours, and can't just clean two days before an inspection. A week before, yes, but not two days! I am not a messy person, but that is unreasonable. i am a grown adult. they don't need to check up on me to make sure i clean! Also they just sent out a notice that they will be inspecting our porches, and threaten to throw out our stuff that is not "supposed to be there" I have had it. I am done with this apartment complex. DONE. Don't move here. You will regret it.

Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 11/20/2015
Pros: Staff is professional, helpful, and responsive to problems with the apartment. Maintenance generally fixes issues quickly. Apartments are very close to essential shopping--Target, Harris Teeter, Fresh Market, CVS, several restaurants, and businesses on 15-501. Cons: What finally drove me to leave was roaches. For the first few months living here, everything was fine. I always kept the kitchen clean, took trash out promptly, etc. And then... roaches. Some neighbors clearly didn't have the best sanitation practices, leaving trash outside at all hours even when the complex has a clear policy that you are not supposed to do this. The complex would send a pest control guy out regularly, but it did not appear to make any difference. I had to store all my food in sealed plastic bags or in the freezer. Would regularly find roaches in the dishwasher, microwave, toaster--horrible. I ended up throwing away several appliances while I lived there and when I moved because they just seemed to be a breeding ground for roaches. Also, increasingly, residents did not seem to have any respect for common areas--leaving trash in the parking lots (when there are outdoor trash cans for this purpose). I would often see maintenance guys picking up trash in the mornings. I just don't get it. I got a few letters while I lived there about cars being broken into. I never had any issues with safety, personally, and there was usually a police car parked on the property.

Report
Resident
2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/30/2015
I've lived at Springfield for a little over three months. Overall, I've been very happy with my decision. For the money you're paying, you get probably one of the best deals in the area. (I searched extensively for an affordable one-bedroom apartment that wasn't in a bad part of town, and this was the best bang for the buck.) Valet trash is a mandatory addition to rent, but this is pretty common elsewhere and only $25 a month. The grounds are fairly decent although a little more outside maintenance would be nice. Stairwells in the individual buildings get pretty unpleasant as they're never swept or cleaned. Interiors of the apartments are decent, nothing spectacular, but a wood-burning fireplace, open floor plan, and large screened patio are very nice features. It's a very quiet neighborhood which is probably one of my favorite things. It's a pretty even mix of people (college students, families, young professionals, and older individuals) and I have had only one or two instances where a neighbor was just playing music too loud. I feel very safe as well, which is important, especially for someone living alone. People have mentioned issues with bugs, which honestly you will have regardless of what apartment complex you live in. Before I moved to Springfield, I was living in a very nice college student apartment complex and had a cockroach infestation there. No matter how clean you are, if your neighbors aren't then you're likely to have issues too. I did have some issues with cockroaches during the warmer weather as I believe they were coming in from the apartment next to me. It didn't amount to an infestation, but definitely enough to have me call maintenance. My problem with Springfield lays there. Insect control comes fairly often, but when they came to take care of the cockroaches, all they did was leave a single glue trap under my kitchen sink. For anyone that's had cockroaches before, you know that a single glue trap won't do anything against them. I realize it's the non-toxic option, but completely ineffective. Rather than bother with waiting for them to come around again and potentially not do anything better, I bought my own cockroach bait and that fixed the issue. I would recommend they find a better company for this service. Overall, I've been very happy here. The staff in the office are wonderful and generally very willing to help. I had an issue early on with something and they fixed it quickly. This isn't the highest quality apartment complex in the world, but you get what you pay for. It's quiet, safe, a good location, great features, and good management. I would definitely recommend.

2014 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/08/2015
Our experience here has been great, honestly. Office staff are friendly and helpful, and the maintenance guys are great. The buildings are clean but vintage 80's; they have recently remodeled apts for a little more $. The gym is minimal but convenient if you can't swing a membership anywhere. What else? The pool is a decent size but only 5' deep. Maintenance issues have always been addressed quickly, the screened in porch is nice, top-floor apts have vaulted ceilings, parking isn't numbered, appliances in our older model are vintage but work just fine. Our neighbors aren't chatty but they're nice enough, lots of families, so pretty quiet most of the time. It feels safe enough for me and my wife, the staff are all really great, and the price/location/size all work for us. Come check them out.

Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/17/2015
Suddenly there is a rush of good reviews at Springfield, which is very surprising to say the least... But this is long time coming. I have a completely opposite experience to share. I lived at Springfield apartments from May 2014 to April 2015, in apartment #1719 (1 bed, 1st floor). One week into moving in I had mice in my apartment. Saw droppings everywhere - on the kitchen floor, stove, counter top, cabinets under the sink and even my dining table. The management at first was very skeptical, and almost did not believe me but when they caught a couple of mice using traps, they had no choice but to try and get rid of the problem. But they were unsuccessful. So the problem continued for one whole year and I got no break from it. No one offered a rent cut, and no one took responsibility of the fact that I was given a bad apartment. Then a few months later my apartment got broken into. This time, I tried to transfer to a new apartment within the same community (so as to avoid the lease break fee).They were not considerate of my situation and refused to even hold me to my old rent in case I transferred to a new apartment. Eventually I did not move, and continued to suffer for the rest of the year - with the mice situation going on the entire time! Of course I lost peace of mind, was depressed all the time, and did not even want to come home after work!! When the resident messed up the management immediately sen out a warning or slapped a fee. When the management messed up, they simply shrug it off as a non-issue, gave excuses or tried to bully the resident into feeling that there's nothing that can be done. The management kept defending themselves by saying we "tried" to get rid of the mice. The efforts were clearly not enough, and that's why the problem persisted. The real issue was that they gave me a bad apartment, and the mice shouldn't have been there in the first place! The apartments themselves were in dire need of upgrades - especially the W/D in the unit was a zillion years old and made a ruckus every time I ran it. The rent is cheap, but you get what you pay for. Tennis court is so badly maintained, it's not even funny. Not to mention the lack of safety. There is a forest surrounding one side of the community, an easy entry and exit way for robbers. I had to pay a heavy price for it. No efforts were made after SEVERAL apartments were broken into last year to even consider putting up a fence. Always one or the other excuse about why it can't be done. Do not believe them if they tell you this complex is safe. IT IS NOT!!! Finally, I had to move out 45 days before the end of lease, as I could not take it any more. I even continued to pay the rent for the apartment with mice in it after leaving - I was not granted any relief whatsoever. I was a good resident, and yet I was treated badly.

Report
Resident
2013 - 2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/17/2013
I moved into Springfield Apartments in March of 2013 & when I first arrived I wrote a review; since then a few things have changed. I renewed my lease for this upcoming year, because I am still currently looking for a house! I wasn't thrilled to renew simply because my rent was raised. I can see raising rent if they were upgrading or making changes; that's not the case. I love my neighbors and we all get along VERY well. We always chit chat and hangout near the tennis courts -- no one uses them (well actually I believe I ONCE saw a couple playing), but they are in poor condition. They bring out their puppies so we can all unwind after our long days at work/school. As I come to find out from my neighbors (who signed their leases after mine) that the complex was going to tear down the dingy unused tennis courts to build a dog park! Oh wow I thought, "this is going to be great!"...As time passed on by we noticed no work being done on this so called "playing condition tennis court". Out of curiosity a neighbor of mine decided to ask the gals in the office when it was scheduled to be done. Nothing was going to be done until October or September I believe -- Okay, so we wait longer which is not a problem IF THEY HADN'T PROMISED A DOG PARK TO PEOPLE SIGNING LEASES!! So, yes they will have a dog park, but no not until your lease is almost up. My neighbors proceeded to contact Cottonwood; they received not so nice letters telling them to stop bugging the gals in the office. As I mentioned earlier they all have their dogs play in the tennis courts -- its fenced off so it's safe for them to run around and get their yayas out. Shortly after the questions started pouring in about the dog park management put letters on the gates to the tennis courts stating NO PETS. Another blow! Frustrated my neighbors had to result in having their furry loved ones play in an open patch of grass beside the 900 building (not safe -- no fence). Just when you think it's all over -- management sent the courtesy officer to notify them they will be fined for having their dogs outside without a leash! Look at the end of the day I get it. I get that somethings are delayed due to funds, time, availability, etc., BUT you don't continue to feed prospective/current renters bs answers. Management should have handled this situation in a different light rather than attacking its current residents. Working in customer service myself I understand the importance of keeping your customers happy and satisfied, unfortunately this situation has done more harm than good. What if I have a problem one day? Will I be targeted and treated with the same disrespect? With all that said I personally have never had a problem with the staff and Carly has always been lovely which is what makes writing this review that much harder. This is in no way personal, but I am rather disappointed to see how resident issues are being handled and feel obligated to inform any interested renters. As for the good: the clubhouse is kept well, gym is decent, pool has a nice layout, maintenance is doing their thing and doing it well - though they aren't always the friendliest, landscaping crew is thorough and very sociable, fixed parking lots/walkways are tons better and location is perfect for many families, business men/women and students. If ANYONE has any comments, questions or concerns you are more than welcome to e-mail me @ sarah.wd.94@gmail.com

Resident
2008 - 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/23/2010
I lived at Springfield for just over two years. I have seen staff come and go. If you're looking for a basic, spacious apartment with a roof over your head, this apartment suites your needs. The pool is nice, but just needs some simple aesthetic repairs. The cook-out/picnic area is nice and shaded. The tennis court doubles as a dog park (LOL). The maintenance staff is awesome!! Anytime I've ever needed anything repaired, it was fixed within 1-2 days. One time my air conditioner broke, they came out right away and repaired it. It broke down yet again, and they gave me a window a/c unit so I could sleep at night. Within just a few days, a brand new air conditioner was installed and the problem was fixed! At the apartment complex I live at now, they basically tell me the a/c units are old and they can only do so much. (Ok...so why is that my problem when I pay rent there?) Anyway, I digress. Roaches...they come with almost any apartment or any place where you have multiple people living in the same vicinity. Anytime I saw one roach, I notified the office. Someone comes once a week to spray anywhere people report a problem. I had two roach issues while I was there. Both times I reported it, and both times, someone was there within a week to spray around the apartment. Problem fixed. Like someone else in a prior review put...it takes vigilant residents to make the apartment community a nice place to live. It's not the apartment staff's fault, or the fault of the police that dirtbag residents invite their dirtbag friends over and decide to have a loud party. If you have a problem, confront the issue. Either get the BALLS to go and talk to your neighbor and resolve the issue, or call the police and let them deal with it. People watch too much TV and think the police can solve all their problems. Like I said, anytime I have a problem with noise or something, I go and talk to my neighbor about it. Communication is key people! If you talk to your neighbor and are nice, you shouldn't have any problems. If you go busting up into the office and yell at the staff because your lightbulb is out, of course they're gonna tell you to leave! Some of the reviews here are unrealistic and make me sick. I've never had a problem with any of the staff, maintenance, or my personal safety.

- Have noticed that a few cars have been broken into. - When a friend went to inform staff that their apartment was broken into (on the 2nd floor with no forced entry) they threatened to call the police if my friend didn't leave the rental office. - Trash compactors are typically over flowing with trash bags even with the valet trash pick-up ($25/month, not included in rent). - Maintenance disregards the doggie stations and people don't pick up after their pets. - Laundry facilities are dirty and machines break down without being repaired for several weeks. - Apartment staff is good at prying for information, even about your neighbors (in regards to pets). - Apartment staff will not admit to their wrongs and are good at placing blame on residents or past staff. - Maintenance staff are okay but not top of the line. - Many neighbors have moved out because "the place is not as nice as it used to be." - Parking lot construction is fairly confusing at first and not the safest. - Multiple issues with leaks. - Maintenance is decent about responding to jobs but don't always finish them properly. - Lots of renters have small dogs (good if you are a pet owner). - Apartment could have used a better cleaning before moving in. - Walls are not flat paint (which makes it difficult to clean). - Renovated apartment ( additional $50 month) means new cabinets, counters, and tile. Not appliances. - Poor lighting in apartment. - The "gym" is small and most the equipment is not fully functional.

Resident
2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 02/26/2010
The facts are there if you care to look at them. As far as apartments in Durham. I've lived in a few apartments in my life and of the ones in Durham for modest rates this is by far the best for 3 simple reasons; 1) proximaty to essential shopping needs 2) essential amenities 3) modest rates compared to mortgages and apartments offerings in the area. As far as the rates I don't like the algorithem to determine pricing but it's better than subjective pricing by area apartments who base on financial need of complex (ask others and you'll see). The lease agreement is standard. I called NC Fair Housingowns Durham Housing authority to compare and it to NC state leases it's exactly the same lease agreement required. Also, i find the apartment complex does need more security to allow afterhours usage of business center. And the pool is by far cleaner than most. I would like to see a jacuzzi added one day if anyone from the corporate offices is reading this. The BBQ area is accomadating enough for two families. And the parking is modest although I would love for an optional reaevqtion space system because at times spaces become unavailable at times. The office staff throws regular events that are not too well attended which means more food for me :). I think you will not find a more realistic and entusiasric office staff willing to help wihtin legal guidelines that keeps all residents in mind when concerning requests that are for a singular persons convenience and not the good of the community, such as noise complaints, if people have issues be neighborly and talk to your neighbor don't expect staff to do it for you. Also, if the community came together more to ask for changes then that's the best way to effect change, this is the era of Obama change can be done when more than one says change is needed. I will have more to say as the time comes :)

anonymous 02/16/2010

Honeybunches33: when a lease expires rent reverts to "market rate," which in rexryan666's case was $240 over the rate under the lease. So, they were faced with the choice of living month to month at an extra $240 per month, or signing a new lease. This foces the lessee to choose adding $240 per month to their budget, plus moving costs and a security deposit at a new place, or continuing to pay to rate under the lease for another year. This is a textbook renewal trap. Make the costs of severing the lease prohibitive. The rational consumer is then forced to decide between the misery of lving in Springfield another year or the hardship of finding an extra $240 per month plus moving costs and new lease costs.

anonymous 02/16/2010

Moving out is always a choice. No one can force you to sign a new lease. If you are that unhappy, why did you sign a new lease?

After a long stressful workweek spent slaving to pay back my student loans, I decided to go for a Saturday morning swim. As I lamented the bad economy that forced me to live at Springfield after years of college and graduate study, I prepared to dive into the pool. But, before the plunge, I looked down and saw what appeared to be a used condom and a rather large pair of ripped ladies underwear floating in the water. No swim for me! That moment (in addition to provoking an existential crisis) is Springfield in a microcosm. Dirty, shocking and upsetting. Interestingly enough, on my last day in Springfield, I had the pleasure of listening to a detoxing addict slam on the door of my downstairs neighbor between 6AM-7AM, screaming "open the mf-ing door." (edited) Over and over and over again. I didn't call the police, and no one else did either! Why not? Learned helplessness! After living somewhere like Springfield for over a year, we no longer expected the basic right to sleep in peace without loud and threatening language all around. I could go on and on. Seriously, there are some real nice places very near Springfield. Take a look and see for yourself. The management seems to be planting shameless positive reviews. What a disgrace!

Resident
2006 - 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 02/12/2010
The apartments are over 20 years old. Most have been remodeled, in good shape, and priced accordingly. They are in a central location close to shopping, and both the DATA, and TTA bus lines. Wooded property offers great sound deadening along with great views including some wildlife. They offer clean facilities including a gym, a racquetball court, swimming pool, tennis courts, a business office, and an onsite laundromat. I have lived in 3 different units here during my last 4 years and have not noticed any problems with bugs. Unruly tenants however like any other apartment can be an issue. Unfortunately the Fair Housing Act won't let management ask the question "Are you a potential criminal?" on the application. Management and Durham Police are quick to acknowledge and take corrective measures to complaints. I have found the maintenance staff to be quick to respond to issues and fix right in an appropriate amount of time. One drawback is the one trash compactor location for the whole complex. As far as the staff is concerned I have nothing but good things to say I have had a good relationship with management. Grubb & Ellis has done a great job in selecting a team to run their property. Unfortunately on some of the other reviews I read where a few other residents experience was less than favorable, I cannot understand why. The staff is friendly and professional, just like any relationship whether it's business, or personal you are going to get out of it exactly what you put into it. I would recommend Springfield to anyone looking to move to the area.

2009 - 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 02/03/2010
I've been here six months without any problems. Maintenance issues are fixed the day they are reported. Within the first two months, the staff knew my name. Neighbors are friendly: this past weekend, after 8 inches of snow, we helped clean off each others cars. I have never felt unsafe, never seen the police around, and never heard of any incidents. The buildings aren't new, but they're well kept. I have the biggest closet I've seen in my life, and I'm thrilled about it. My only complaint as to parking is that there was no salt or anything put down after the snow, and even several days later, there was still dangerous ice in places. However, since snow and ice aren't particularly common in the area, it isn't a significant problem. There are a lot of places in the area that are a pretty big step up in price for not a big step up in quality. I'm happy with my choice to live in Springfield.

Also, your rent will convert to the "market rate" which is typically between $150-$200 higher than your lease rate. The tenants are very loud and there are frequent gatherings in the parking lots in the middle of the night. You will hear fights and profanity from other residents on a regular basis. If you choose to ue the pool, expect to find disgusting items floating in and littering the ground beside the pool. The apartments are dark, drab and depressing. This is the worst place I have ever lived. There were multiple instances of drug addicts banging on doors at odd hours screaming at either their dealer or spouse inside to let them in to get a fix. There are a number of better choices nearby. DO NOT PUNISH YOURSELF!

2006 - 2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 03/19/2008
I am a current resident at Springfield. ENTIRELY different from when I moved in a year and a half ago. Their prices are going up but they're showing no sort of improvement. When I first moved in, residents were kept up-to-date with newsletters monthly, our apartments were regularly inspected, and maintenance was immaculate. My problems would be fixed the same day, and most times the same hour. The management has changed 3 or 4 times since I've been here and the current management is just not good. I like hip-hop music but I find it inappropriate to play in the lease office-- which they do. I am happy to be getting away from this sort of management, but also saddened because they are beautiful apartment homes inside and out. The neighborhood was quiet and felt safe at one time, but no longer because there have been attempts to break in my car twice. I recommend living here, but after they change their current management.

I pack all my stuff up in my other apt and headed down to Springfield. I signed my lease and wrote out the check and everything...then the girl tells me that the apt is not ready and that it wont be ready til that Tuesday (this was Saturday). Apparently, the chick that I talked to didn't document any of what I had said, she just said "uh-huh yeah, you can move in early". Of course I was thoroughly upset because I had packed up everything and I needed to move that day. Nevermind the fact that I had already called in my phone and electricity people to turn on everything. Long story short, the woman claims that there wasn't anything to do but put my family up in a hotel (which is good, at least they tried to do that) and that there wasn't another available apt. out there. I turned down the hotel, because my family had other places to be and I definitely wasn't lifting that stuff myself. I got back my deposit and told them I was going elsewhere. Resident
2003 - 2005 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/08/2005
When I first moved in at Springfield, I had a great feeling about the place. The maintenance staff was very friendly and responsive, the rent was fairly low, and the location was very convenient. <br><br>Things went very well until another management company stepped in. There were new faces in the rental office every time I went in. The new maintenance staff ranged from creepy and uncommunicative to downright rude. One of them came in to check a leaky seal in one of the windows in my apartment. (I had been putting in work orders on this once a month for about 4-5 months.) He said that there were major flaws with the installation of the windows. Then he left, and nothing was ever done to rectify the situation. <br><br>The "replumbing" issue mentioned in the previous review was extremely inconvenient and handled poorly by the management. Someone would sneak around and put flyers out in the evenings (this is standard operating procedure for all notices from the management, I've come to believe). In the morning, if you were lucky, you would find the note and scramble into the shower before they shut off your water that day. Sometimes the water would be shut off without notice. <br><br>We were told which areas of our apartment were "safe zones" in which to put our belongings during the replumbing. Some of my electronic devices in the so-called "safe zone" were showered with dust from a hole cut into my wall. We were asked to board any pets for the duration of the replumbing. I boarded my pet at great expense, not covered by the management, and finally just brought her home when I could not detect that any work had been done in my apartment. No notice was given that the replumbing in my apartment was complete. If I had waited until their series of "final notice.. no, wait, THIS is the final notice.. no, we still need to invade your apartment for just one more walkthrough.." messages terminated, then my pet boarding bill would have been in the hundreds of dollars. <br><br>The fitness center is convenient but poorly maintained. At the time I was fortunate enough to leave Springfield, one of the two treadmills wasn't working, and various pins for the weight machines had been lost or broken. The elliptical machine is of poor construction and the motion is very jerky.<br><br>I have lived in a worse apartment than Springfield, to be sure. It has its perks - it's quiet, it's very convenient to the South Square shopping area and to 15-501, and the rent (at least before the gaudy "EXTREME MAKEOVER!" signs went up to stay) was relatively low. The major problem with Springfield is the staff. The office staff treats tenants like annoyances and the maintenance staff only addresses minor problems with any degree of punctuality or competence. <br><br>You could do worse than Springfield, but trust me - over time, irritation with management will build until you wonder what possessed you to sign a lease there in the first place. Rent here only as a last resort!

For the price you can pretty much move anywhere in the triangle. And I recommend doing that. If you need to a specific example to beleive me go in and talk to Darlene and see how she treats you. Probably like gold the first time. Stick around and see how she treats the people she has already suckered into signing a lease. Read less

Resident
2002 - 2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/02/2003
I picked Springfield out of all the other University Drive apartment complexes because of the low rent (with 12 month lease) and the layout of the apartment. Soon later, I noticed a plethora of problems ranging from slanted counters, deceptive management (-----rententive with details), unannounced 7-8 AM lawn-mowing, -----´s lease break fee, pothole obstacle course through the parking, non-functioning laundry room that never gets fixed despite numerous complaints, bugs and dirt outside apartment, bad balcony & trash policy, cold hottub, trashy fitness center, and Darlene (you´ll know what I´m talking about once you go there). <br> <br>Just to demonstrate what the management is like: I was out of the state once and called to ask for rent collection methods. The only option was by mail. Since I was in California and rent was due in 2 days, I asked them if I could send them a confirmation number of my mail instead of fedex-ing overnight. The management refused and I ended up paying $22 for the fedex (b/c why should I pay THEM the $25 dollars late fee). Another example of the rent issue was that they do not send reminders, etc. for the rent collection. On the 8th or 9th day they will rubberband a notice on your door saying your rent was late past the 6th and that I will have to pay the late fee, etc, following with a court filing fee if I go beyond the 10th. So, I suggest the management to give rent reminders like postcards in the mailbox so people pay on time instead of everyone missing the date (4 out of 6 of my neighbors had the rubberband note on their doors). If not that, I told them that they should at least put the rubberband notice out on the 5th so people have a day to pay. But no, the money-hungry managment actually said, "Sorry, we don´t do that," and shot down my suggestion in a second.

Resident
2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/17/2003
A lot has changed in the two years I have been here at Springfield. Unfortunately, the general apathetic if not hostile nature of the Springfield management indicates no changes for the better are on the horizon. The level of noise is unbearable. The fact that I constantly wear ear plugs at home should be telling. Security is pathetic as both my car and a visiting friend´s car were broken into directly in front of my apartment. Maintenance is another nightmare. Forget about the gym-- the equipment is usually broken. Forget about the pool-- if it is actually open, it is dirty and generally you can´t even use it dirty due to summer "repairs." If you want to have a quality living experience, do not live at Springfield. Even if you only want a tolerable living environment, live elsewhere. I am thrilled to finally be free from my lease.

Resident
2000 - 2002 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/03/2002
Agree with previous comments. The staff, although pleasant, are not completely educated about apartment policies and seem less than equiped to professionally manage such a property. Were the property priced differently, the expectations may not be so high. Important documents are "rubber banded" to resident doors in the hopes that the residents will get it in time to 1)Understand their water may be cut off when they try to get ready in the morning and 2)See that it is an important document under all of the pizza coupons and soliciter information also constantly attached to the door. <br>The apartments are attractively laid out, but highly prone to dust and spiders. The exterior of our building was not maintained and I never once saw anyone cleaning, sweeping around our building. They are certainly not priced fairly for square footage. There are definitely better deals available. <br>On several occasions I called maintenance for a particular request, to never have it repaired. <br>The pool was never clean on the many occasions we utilized it. <br>I also favored the apartment because it had a fairly accessible work out facility. I was told upon move in that this was a 24 hour facility. On more occasions than not, the code to this facility was either not working or locked to residents, thus not being available when promised. <br>The area is also extremely unsecure and there are no alarm systems, gates and all doors only consist of one lock. <br>I do not recommend this apartment to anyone. MOST IMPORTANTLY- there are so many other newer, nicer apartments with comparable prices to this one, much better square footage and tighter security.

Report
Resident
2000 - 2002 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/15/2002
I agree with the other guy; this place is not worth the price. <br> <br>There seem to be a lot of water line problems in the complex. At least 6 times over the 18 months I lived there, water was shut off the my building. I received advance notice of this every time but once. Advance notice at Springfield consists of a note rubber-banded to your door around 10:00 p.m. the night before, so if you don´t go outside before your morning shower, you´ll get stuck. (I had the water cut off during my morning shower twice :) <br> <br>The office staff is friendly. Maintenance is poor. I complained about a leaking dishwasher twice, but it was never fixed. My upstairs neighbor let her washing machine overflow once, and it took many calls and several weeks to get the damage to my apartment repaired. <br> <br>Walls are thin. My first neighbor made my life a living hell with his 1,000,000-watt stereo. The office staff was sympathetic, but gutless. The ------boy neighbor moved out after 9 months, and I never heard a peep out of the new folks living there. <br> <br>They entered my apartment without notice once, and let my cat out. But, they at least had the smarts to call me at work and let me know I needed to come home and find my cat. Parking can be a problem in the evenings. <br> <br>The pool is nice and well maintained. Grounds are kept in very good condition. The exercise room is well equipted. <br> <br>In this area of Durham, you must be very security conscious. In the much worse apartment complex next door, a young Duke student was murdered one night after a man broke in to her ground floor apartment. On the other hand, I had lots of female neighbors, and none of them expressed feeling unsafe at Springfield. <br> <br>Lots of shopping close by. Access to RTP is about 20 minutes.

Resident
2000 - 2002 Not Recommended Reviewed 02/21/2002
Apartments are nicely laid out. The management is very friendly, but one gets the feeling that they are not quite up to the task of running such a large complex. <br> <br>Maintanence is hit-or-miss. Occasionally problems are corrected immediately, but usually two or three calls are required. <br> <br>Noise is a major problem. The apartments are not well insulated from exterior sounds and neighboring apartments. Many of the tenants are students at nearby Duke University, so evenings and weekends can be quite noisy. <br> <br>Crime is a definate concern in this area of Durham, although I personally have not had any problems. <br> <br>My biggest beef is their insistance on entering the apartment very frequently for things such as routine maintanence (changing air filters), requested maintanence (see above, however), and "mandatory inspections".

    Restrictions: We welcome 2 pets per apartment home. There is a $300 non-refundable pet fee for the 1st pet and $200 for the 2nd. Monthly pet rent is $20. Aggressive breeds are prohibited. Please call our leasing office for complete pet policy information.

Leasing

Welcome home! Springfield Apartments features six spacious floor plans with one and two bedroom layouts. Amenities include vaulted ceilings, walk-in closets, and mirror-sliding closet doors. The property features an on-site car care center, swimming pool and racquetball court.

Management Company: Pegasus Residential*

Office Hours Open Now!

  • Sunday: Closed
  • Monday - Friday: 09:00 AM - 06:00 PM
  • Saturday: 10:00 AM - 05:00 PM
